Question
========
Which of the following situations is not an assumption for correct interpretation of the results of a multiple linear regression analysis?

Answerlist
----------
* The observations used to collect the research data (variables) are dependent on each other.
* The distribution of the observed scores of the dependent variable Y around the best-fit regression line is approximately evenly distributed for the different values of the Xs.
* The prediction errors are normally distributed when the regression model is applied.
* The statistical relationship between the independent variables (Xs) in the model is not too strong.
